ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: A high level interface for 'torch' providing utilities to reduce the the amount of code needed for common tasks, abstract away torch details and make the same code work on both the 'CPU' and 'GPU'. It's flexible enough to support expressing a large range of models. It's heavily inspired by 'fastai' by Howard et al. (2020) <arXiv:2002.04688>, 'Keras' by Chollet et al. (2015) and 'PyTorch Lightning' by Falcon et al. (2019) <doi:10.5281/zenodo.3828935>.

A high level interface for 'torch' providing utilities to reduce the the amount of code needed for common tasks, abstract away torch details and make the same code work on both the 'CPU' and 'GPU'. It's flexible enough to support expressing a large range of models. It's heavily inspired by 'fastai' by Howard et al. (2020) <arXiv:2002.04688>, 'Keras' by Chollet et al. (2015) and 'PyTorch Lightning' by Falcon et al. (2019) <doi:10.5281/zenodo.3828935>.

name: r-luz
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.5.1" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-luz
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/luz_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/luz/luz_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: b2f8c96712e9a548ee1cc95baad4ac77795e47d9809332b4eb46cbae6b225fea

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/
  missing_dso_whitelist:
    - '*/R.dll'        # [win]
    - '*/Rblas.dll'    # [win]
    - '*/Rlapack.dll'  # [win]

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-r6
    - r-cli
    - r-coro
    - r-fs
    - r-generics
    - r-glue
    - r-magrittr
    - r-prettyunits
    - r-progress
    - r-purrr
    - r-rlang >=1.0.0
    - r-torch >=0.11.9000
    - r-zeallot
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-r6
    - r-cli
    - r-coro
    - r-fs
    - r-generics
    - r-glue
    - r-magrittr
    - r-prettyunits
    - r-progress
    - r-purrr
    - r-rlang >=1.0.0
    - r-torch >=0.11.9000
    - r-zeallot

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('luz')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('luz')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://mlverse.github.io/luz/, https://github.com/mlverse/luz
  license: MIT
  summary: A high level interface for 'torch' providing utilities to reduce the the amount of code needed for common tasks, abstract away torch details and make the same code work on both the 'CPU' and 'GPU'. It's flexible enough to support expressing a large range of models. It's heavily inspired by 'fastai' by Howard et
    al. (2020) <arXiv:2002.04688>, 'Keras' by Chollet et al. (2015) and 'PyTorch Lightning' by Falcon et al. (2019) <doi:10.5281/zenodo.3828935>.
  license_family: MIT
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/MIT'
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
